Tom was standing outside the window, listening to Mary and John talking.
kor: 톰은 메리와 존이 말하는 것을 들으며 창문 밖에 서 있었다.

eng: Tom is so irresponsible. I can't believe it.
kor: 톰은 정말 무책임하다. 믿기지 않을 정도로.

eng: Tom baked three pies.
You still look depressed.
I need to buy something to eat.
kor: 난 먹을 만한 것 좀 사야겠어.

eng: He kept me waiting.
No one recognized me.
I was popular in high school.
Tom likes butter too much.
If I tell the truth, I'll be killed.
kor: 내가 만약 진실을 말하면 난 살해 당할 거야.

eng: What's the horse's name?
How many times do I need to repeat it?
I'm happiest when I'm singing.
kor: 난 노래 부르고 있을 때가 가장 행복해.

eng: I had to work overtime yesterday.
The cause of the accident is unknown.
I don't feel anything at all.
Tom didn't study for his final exam.
I'm sorry to bother you so often.
Why didn't you use a pay phone?
Tom is getting coffee.
The water flows under the bridge.
I've been kidnapped.
Tom didn't tell Mary why he had to work late.
kor: 톰은 메리에게 왜 그가 늦게까지 일해야 했는지 알려주지 않았다.

eng: I don't like talking with Tom.
kor: 난 톰이랑 대화하는 걸 좋아하지 않아.

eng: You're not mad at me anymore, are you?
kor: 너 더 이상 나한테 화내지 않는 거지?

eng: I thought you might be lonely, so I came over with a bottle of wine.
kor: 니가 좀 외로울 것 같아서 내가 와인 한 병을 들고 왔지.

eng: I like learning languages.
I was afraid I might be late.
Everybody needs to be quiet.
Tom kicked the ball really hard.
I hope you tore up my last letter.
kor: 내 마지막 편지는 찢어 버렸길 바란다.

eng: I'm glad to hear Tom did that.
That's why I can't help you.
kor: 이게 바로 내가 널 도와줄 수 없는 이유야.

eng: Have you ever been to Canada?
This isn't our final destination.
I regret that I did not work harder.
kor: 난 더 열심히 안 한 걸 후회하고 있어.

eng: Is there anything you want us to send you from home?
kor: 우리가 집에서 너에게 보내줬으면 하는 거 없니?

eng: He kissed his daughter on the forehead.
kor: 그는 그의 딸 이마에 뽀뽀를 했다

eng: I major in economics.
My mother said that she was all right.
kor: 우리 엄마가 그 사람은 괜찮다고 말했어.

eng: The cost of the book is five dollars.
We'll be right here.
I'll give this to Tom.
Tom was three when his mother was killed in a traffic accident.
kor: 톰은 어머님이 교통사고로 돌아가셨을 때 세 살이었어.

eng: The room is crawling with spiders.
These scissors don't cut well.
I should've told you everything earlier.
kor: 너한테 모든 걸 좀 더 빨리 얘기했어야 했는데.

eng: That's just about it.
Tom learned to dive when he was thirteen.
kor: 톰은 열 세살일 때 잠수하는 법을 배웠어.

eng: Why does everybody think Tom and I are stupid?
kor: 왜 다들 나랑 톰이 멍청하다고 생각해?

eng: I heard that Tom attempted suicide.
Is there something that you want to tell me?
Tom doesn't want to get into trouble.
You're very astute.
I felt very isolated.
Tom is married to a Canadian named Mary.
This dictionary is mine.
Everyone wants to go to heaven, but nobody wants to die.
kor: 모두 천국에 가고 싶어 하나, 누구도 죽고 싶어 하지 않는다.

eng: Are you trying to hit on me?
How many years did you live in Australia?
I run faster than Tom.
kor: 나는 톰보다 빠르게 달릴 수 있어.

eng: I go to school by subway.
That's my main focus.
You two are adorable!
I hope Tom is coming.
Can you help me install this software?
kor: 이 소프트웨어 설치하는 법을 알려줄 수 있어?

eng: Tom put his shirt on inside out.
I run 10 kilometers every day.
I'm going through my closet to find clothes to give to charity.
I've been dying to see Tom.
kor: 난 톰이 너무 보고 싶어 죽겠어.

eng: I sincerely regret having caused you such an inconvenience.
It took me several hours to do that.
Tom thinks that I'm romantic.
Can I borrow your radio?
I really appreciate all your help.
Tom hasn't yet learned how to write his own name.
kor: 톰은 자기 이름을 쓰는 법을 아직 안 배웠어.

eng: Could you make sure Tom is OK?
I don't have much money, but I can get along somehow.
kor: 나는 돈이 별로 없지만, 그럭저럭 지낼 수 있다

eng: I told Tom to lie.
Tom is definitely not going to be there.
kor: 톰은 확실히 거기에 가 있지 않을 거야.

eng: This isn't our final destination.
That would be like sawing off the branch you're sitting on.
kor: 그건 니가 앉아있는 가지를 쳐내는 꼴이야.

eng: I've been trying to reach you all day.
kor: 나는 오늘 하루종일 너에게 연락하려고 했어.

eng: I took this picture a week ago.
The tire factory employs 250 people.
I hope that this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
I have never felt better.
Why is Tom a better choice than Mary?
kor: 왜 톰이 메리보다 더 좋은 선택이야?

eng: People with autism tend to have trouble with social interactions.
kor: 자폐증을 가진 사람들은 사회생활에 어려움을 갖는 경향이 있어.

eng: We had fun with Tom.
The earth is much larger than the moon.
Tom dyed his hair green.
Tom is having a hard time focusing.
Tom doesn't cut any corners.
I'm thinking about going back into teaching.
You should stop singing.
kor: 너 노래 그만 불러야할 것 같아.

eng: If I were you, I'd call a doctor.
kor: 내가 만약 너라면 의사를 부를 텐데.

eng: I prefer spring to autumn.
Tom is ashamed of his body.
I like helping others.
I asked Tom not to do that anymore.
I'm happy we're working together.
Tom really wants to lose weight.
I'm going to be at home this afternoon.
Is there something you want to tell me?
Tom hasn't eaten at a restaurant since he lost his job.
kor: 톰은 직업을 잃은 뒤로 레스토랑에서 식사한 적이 없어.

eng: Tom is sitting on the porch.
I have to look after this cat.
Tom is a pretty good poet.
How many times do I need to repeat it?
You are not a good person. You know that, right?
kor: 넌 그다지 좋은 사람이 아냐. 너도 그건 알고 있지?

eng: What's your favorite image editing software?
kor: 어떤 것이 네가 가장 좋아하는 사진 편집 소프트웨어야?

eng: We know what Tom is going through.
kor: 우리는 톰이 겪고있는 것을 알고 있다.

eng: A virus infected Tom's computer.
Tom often sings in his car.
kor: 톰은 자기 차 안에서 가끔 노래해.

eng: Tom is a great French teacher.
Tom seems to be very lonely.
Tom wants to play a game.
Tom spent more money than usual.
I feel like this isn't going to end well.
kor: 좋게 끝날 것 같지 않은 기분이야.

eng: Tom looked like he was confused.
Tom and Mary said they were on our side.
I think your hypothesis is correct.
Could you please tell me again where you put the key?
kor: 키를 어디다 뒀는지 다시 얘기해 주시겠어요?

eng: Tom said he wanted to hire someone with experience.
kor: 톰은 경험이 있는 사람을 고용하고 싶다고 말했다.

eng: Can I borrow your pen?
This technique isn't easy to learn.
I informed Tom that I'd do that.
What in the world do you think you're doing?
kor: 세상에 네가 뭘 하고 있다고 생각하는 거니?

eng: She has to study science.
She returned a book to the library.
I always study hard.
That's what I was going to say.
Tom pondered his next move.
She isn't married.
Do you believe this has any use?
I've had enough of your shenanigans.
Which group do you want to join?
My daughter is still under three years old.
Tom wouldn't let them in.
kor: 톰은 그들을 못 들어 오게 했다.

eng: Why should we hire you?
kor: 왜 우리가 당신을 고용해야 하는 거죠?

eng: Sorry, but you can't go in there.
Like father, like son.
Tom filled the wheelbarrow with sand.
He carried six boxes at a time.
kor: 그는 상자 여섯 개를 한 번에 날랐다.

eng: I don't want to throw that away.
How did you spend your winter vacation?
I'll meet Tom tomorrow.
I didn't know that you loved Tom so much.
kor: 네가 톰을 그렇게 사랑할 줄은 몰랐어.

eng: Tom met a friend of Mary's at the airport.
Both of them speak French.
kor: 둘 다 프랑스어를 할 줄 알아.

eng: I think it's definitely worth it.
kor: 이건 확실히 가치 있는 것 같아.

eng: That's all I'm doing.
kor: 그게 내가 하고 있는 것의 전부야.

eng: Walking the dog is my responsibility.
That's my favorite French word.
kor: 이게 바로 내가 가장 좋아하는 프랑스 단어야.

eng: Tom is the strongest man I know.
kor: 톰은 내가 알고 있는 가장 강한 사람이야.

eng: I like Korean cuisine.
When will you get home?
The boys have gone north.
You're lonely, aren't you?
Sorry, I don't get your point.
kor: 미안한데, 무슨 말을 하는지 못 알아듣겠어.

eng: Tom barely passed the exam.
I still don't think it's fair.
kor: 난 아직도 이게 공평하다고 생각하지 않아.

eng: Music is an art, not a science.
Is there something that you want to say?
Tom is allowed to stay. The rest of you have to leave.
kor: 톰은 남아 있어도 돼. 너희 나머지는 떠나야 해.

eng: I should've checked Tom's references.
There are things that can't be left to chance.
kor: 운에 맡길 수 없는 것들이 있다.

eng: I don't read as many books as I used to.
kor: 난 예전만큼 책을 많이 읽지 않아.

eng: I know Tom knows I should do that.
kor: 나는 톰이 내가 그렇게 해야한다는 것을 안다는 것을 안다.

eng: Tom thought that Mary would be jealous.
His sudden appearance surprised us all.
kor: 걔가 갑자기 와서 우리는 다 놀랐어

eng: I want to grow old with my wife.
kor: 난 내 아내와 함께 늙고 싶어.

eng: Women are often judged by their looks.
Can the matter wait till tomorrow?
Tom is one of the most respected men in the business world.
kor: 톰은 업계에서 가장 존경 받는 남성 중 한 사람이야.

eng: Why are you so sure of his success?
kor: 왜 그의 성공을 그렇게 확신하고 있는 거지?

eng: That's not very important to me.
I don't sleep a lot.
Come on. Give it a try.
We've been here since October.
Tom clasped his hands behind his head.
kor: 톰은 머리 뒤로 손을 꽉 잡았어.

eng: The police believe Tom acted alone.
kor: 경찰은 톰이 혼자인 척 했다고 믿고 있어.

eng: We need to know what we're supposed to do on Monday.
kor: 우리는 월요일에 뭘 해야 하는지 알아야 해.

eng: Do you have the most recent version of this software?
kor: 이 소프트웨어의 가장 최신 버전을 갖고 있어?

eng: I don't think that it's weird at all.
kor: 난 그게 전혀 이상하다고 생각 안 해.

eng: Can I have this cup?
I'll kill him.
